questions.text: What is the minimum passing score for quiz-based training?

options.explanation: 60% does not meet the minimum passing threshold.
70% does not meet the minimum passing threshold.
Per Section 5.3, quiz-based training requires a passing score of ≥ 80%.
100% is not required; the minimum is 80%.

questions.text: Within how many days must new employees complete their onboarding training?

options.explanation: 7 days is too short for the full onboarding program.
14 days does not match the requirement.
Per Section 5.4, new employees must complete onboarding training within 30 days.

questions.text: When an SOP is updated, re-training is automatically assigned to personnel in the SOP's required departments.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.5, the QMS platform automatically assigns re-training when an SOP is updated.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a trigger for identifying training needs?

options.explanation: New hires require training per Section 5.2.
Role changes trigger training needs assessment per Section 5.2.
Employee birthdays are not a training needs trigger. Triggers include onboarding, role changes, SOP updates, nonconformances, and regulatory changes.
Knowledge-gap nonconformances trigger training per Section 5.2.

questions.text: What verification method is used for instructor-led training?

options.explanation: Quizzes are used for quiz-based training, not instructor-led.
Acknowledgment is used for policies, not instructor-led training.
Per Section 5.3, instructor-led training is verified by instructor sign-off.
Self-certification is not an accepted verification method.
